full_text:

>

> *You write these posts yet, I do not know your name, maybe i can ask

> me....we do know they are speaking to us because often 2 or 3 people will
> hear the same thing, this is the reason we exchange our files, so that
> others may hear them too.  Last summer when the young lady tech student got
> killed, she was the young Chinese girl that was going to be married that
> week she just disappeared, it was the spirit people from the box that
> reported to me that she had been killed, the first day she came up as only
> missing, I called it in and the cop heard it, and hoped it was only people
> talking about it over the radio, he didn't understand, but the spirit gave
> the name of the guy that killed her, and where they would find her body, and
> sure enough it was all true.  If that was not test enough, I don't know what
> else, yes, I do have all those files intact here on my pc. Thank God, for
> Frank S. as it was he that first worked one the RS radio's and got this off
> the ground, he has a wonderful gift there, and no one can take it away. sf

>>> "We have conducted a few listening studies of reported radio-sweep EVP
>>> and the results have not been good. We have also worked with a variety of
>>> such devices. Based on what we know about trans-etheric influences, how EVP
>>> and visual forms of ITC are formed and what we know about mediumship, it is
>>> difficult to fit radio-sweep into any established hypothesis. Without solid
>>> research supporting it as producing EVP, it is impossible for us to
>>> recommend it or support its use. If there were double-blind studies
>>> conducted by experienced researchers that shows it does produce phenomena,
>>> we would gladly promote it as an alternative technique.
>>>
>>> We are pretty sure that, in transform EVP (ordinary recorder), the voice
>>> is formed in the electronics by transforming available audio-frequency noise
>>> in an active part of the electronics such as a transistor junction. We think
>>> the process is amplification of a weak telekinetic signal via stochastic
>>> resonance and we have found that the optimum audio-frequency signal for this
>>> is a chaotic one rich in voice-frequencies with many transient perturbation.
>>> That is our working hypothesis. "
>>>
>>>  I can't say who this is from, cuz almost certain I'd get sued. There's
>>> no double blind testing their BS either. Clueless!!
